intro: Syntherisma insularis, commonly known as the island syntherism, is a rare flowering plant native to specific island ecosystems. It is characterized by its unique, spiral-shaped leaves that are adapted to capture maximum sunlight in low-light conditions. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, attracting pollinators such as bees and moths. Its root system is fibrous and shallow, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to habitat loss, Syntherisma insularis is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
